references.reason: This is a foundational textbook in reinforcement learning, providing a comprehensive overview of the field's core concepts and algorithms.

references.paper_title: Mastering Atari with discrete world models
references.reason: This paper introduced a model-based reinforcement learning approach that achieved state-of-the-art results on Atari games, demonstrating the power of world models in RL.

references.paper_title: Mastering Atari, Go, chess and shogi by planning with a learned model
references.reason: This work showcased the effectiveness of combining model-based planning with deep reinforcement learning, leading to superhuman performance in complex games.

references.paper_title: Code repair with LLMs gives an exploration-exploitation tradeoff
references.reason: This paper, also by the authors, introduces a novel approach to code generation and repair using LLMs, which is central to their proposed method.
This paper explores the combination of neural networks and symbolic programming, which aligns with the overall approach of the current paper, using Python code to represent world models.
